questions.text: A patient is undergoing modified radical neck dissection (MRND) for laryngeal malignancy. The patient developed hypotension along with cardiac arrhythmia suddenly. Which of the following is the most likely image of his capnography?

You are preparing to intubate a patient in the operating room. As part of your preoperative assessment, you perform a Mallampati examination to assess the patient's airway. Identify the class from the image shown below?

A large cohort study is conducted to assess the association between smoking and squamous cell carcinoma of the esophagus among middie-aged men. During 10 years of follow-up, smokers have 5 times the risk of esophageal carcinoma compared to non-smokers (relative risk 5.0, 95% confidence interval = 2.9-7.1). According to the study results, what percentage of squamous cell carcinoma of the esophagus in smokers can be attributed to smoking?

Identify the correct pair with the type of prevention: Prescriptive screening - Secondary HPV Vaccination against ca cervix - Primary Iodine supplementation in salt - Primordial Pap smear in health camp - Primary Spectacles - tertiary

A 45-year-old man comes to the OPD due to recurrent, painful skin lesions in the right axilla for the past 6 months. The patient has no other medical history and takes no medication. Examination is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Bacterial proliferation in eccrine sweat glands

questions.text: Which is not an obvious advantage of the instrument shown:
Match the following Mapleson circuits with the features described:

A large prospective study evaluates the relationship between alcohol consumption and breast cancer. A total of 4000 middle-aged women are enrolled in the study through a random selection of residential addresses. Daily alcohol consumption and breast cancer incidence are assessed through the use of periodic questionnaires. On five-year follow-up, the investigators report the association between alcohol consumption and breast cancer as a relative risk of 1.32 (95% confidence interval = 0.90-1.85); 800 subjects were lost to follow-up by the end of the study, the majority of whom were moderate to heavy alcohol consumers. According to this information, which of the following biases is most likely to be present and may have affected the results?

A 4-year-old boy is brought to the emergency department for difficulty breathing and a productive cough. He has a past medical history of recurrent episodes of sinusitis and otitis media. The respiratory infections typically have a protracted course but respond to high-dose antibiotic therapy. Pulmonary auscultation shows crackles and wheezing. Cardiovascular examination shows a cardiac point of maximal impulse that is palpated at the right 5 th intercostal space. Which of the following is most likely to be dysfunctional in this patient?
A patient has a visual acuity of less than 3/60 in the right eye and the perception of light in the left eye. In terms of visual impairment categories, to which category does this individual belong?
A patient who was on a ventilator for one week suddenly gets agitated and self-extubates himself. What is the next step of management?

options.label: D
options.text: Watch for spontaneous breaths and re intubate if needed

questions.correct_answer: D. Watch for spontaneous breaths and re intubate if needed
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Watch for spontaneous breaths and re intubate if needed

questions.text: A new estrogen receptor agonist is being evaluated for the treatment of postmenopausal symptoms. A prospective study shows that the drug increases the risk of deep vein thrombosis (DVT) in treated women who smoke compared to untreated women who smoke, with a relative risk(RR) of 1.70 and p-value of 0.01. In nonsmokers, no increased risk of DVT is evident with use of the drug (RR = 0.96; p-value = 0.68). Which of the following describes this phenomenon?
Identify the device shown in the image below?

A 50-year-old man is scheduled to undergo a colonoscopy for routine colorectal cancer screening. He has no abdominal pain, gross blood in the stool, constipation, change in stool caliber, or unintentional weight loss. He also has no family history of colon cancer. The procedure is uncomplicated, but the patient is found to have a small mucosal lesion (~1 cm) in his sigmoid colon. The lesion is biopsied and its histology is shown in the image below. The pathogenesis of this patient's lesion most likely began with a mutation involving which of the following genes?

A 25-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to a 4-week history of a pruritic skin rash. On examination, there are pink papules distributed symmetrically over the anterior surfaces of the shins and ankles. Shave biopsy reveals prominent hyperkeratosis along with a thickened granular layer. In addition, there is a bandlike infiltrate of mononuclear cells in the superficial dermis that involves the overlying epidermis. The rete ridges have a sharpened, sawtooth appearance. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 10-year-old child is brought to the clinic by his parents who are concerned about white patches on her skin that they noticed since childhood. Physical examination is shown below. She mentions that her grandfather had similar patches since his birth. They also report that a cousin on her father's side has been recently diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis. Given the patient's history and clinical presentation, which of the following describes the underlying cause of her condition?

options.label: A
options.text: A polygenic disorder with progressive depigmentation.

options.label: B
options.text: An autosomal dominant disorder involving the C-kit protooncogene.

options.label: C
options.text: An autoimmune condition with progressive depigmentation.

options.label: D
options.text: A sporadic condition without a genetic link.

questions.correct_answer: B. An autosomal dominant disorder involving the C-kit protooncogene.
questions.explanation: Ans. B) An autosomal dominant disorder involving the C-kit protooncogene.

questions.text: Identify the disease transmitted by the vector shown in the image.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Zika virus disease

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aedes aegypti is the vector responsible for transmitting diseases such as Zika virus, dengue, chikungunya, and yellow fever. It is characterized by white stripes on its body and legs and typically breeds in man-made water collections.

questions.text: Researchers are studying the relationship between essential hypertension and a common mutation in the structure of a sodium channel protein. A study population is randomly selected and blood samples are obtained for leukocyte genotyping. The prevalence of hypertension is determined based on mean blood pressure measurements obtained using standardized ambulatory blood pressure monitoring conducted over 1 week. Based on the analysis results, the researchers conclude that the sodium channel structure mutation is associated with hypertension. Which of the following best describes the study design used by the investigators?

You are the team leader during a cardiac arrest resuscitation scenario in a hospital setting. A 65-year-old patient has suddenly collapsed and is unresponsive. The monitor displays a rhythm as shown in the image. What is the next immediate step?
What is the nerve blocked in the following local anesthesia technique?

In the aftermath of a natural disaster, a public health team is tasked with implementing a vaccination protocol to prevent outbreaks of infectious diseases among the affected population. Considering the increased risk of certain infections in post-disaster settings, which of the following vaccination strategies is most appropriate?

options.label: D
options.text: Only the health workers are given Cholera, Typhoid, and Tetanus toxoid

questions.correct_answer: D. Only the health workers are given Cholera, Typhoid, and Tetanus toxoid
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Only the health workers are given Cholera, Typhoid, and Tetanus toxoid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In post-disaster settings, Cholera, Typhoid, and Tetanus toxoid vaccinations are given primarily to health workers, not the general population, as they are most at risk of long-term exposure to these infections.

questions.text: Identify the correct pair of contraceptive dosages: Ulipristal for emergency contraception-30mg single dose LNG for emergency contraception 1.5mg two tablets repeated after 12hrs DMPA 150mg im 3 monthly Mirena 52mg LNG with 20ug/d release

A 29-year-old male presents to the emergency department with a 3-day history of high-grade fever, altered mental status, and severe respiratory distress. His family reports that he recently attended a wedding in a rural area of Kozhikode district of Kerala, where he consumed freshly tapped toddy (tapped from the sap of palm trees), a local drink. Over the next day, three more individuals from the same wedding presented with similar symptoms. On examination, the patient appears lethargic, disoriented, with reduced chest sounds on the right side. His CSF analysis reveals an elevated protein count with normal glucose and an decrease in lymphocytes. Given the clinical presentation and his recent history, which of the following infectious agents is most likely responsible for this outbreak?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Nipah virus

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Nipah virus is an emerging zoonotic infection with potential for outbreaks in regions like Kerala, especially linked to consumption of contaminated fruit or palm sap.

questions.text: Identify the incorrect statement in rapid sequence intubation?

options.label: A
options.text: Preoxygenation with 100% oxygen for 3 minutes is done.

options.label: B
options.text: High-volume low-pressure cuff Endotracheal tube is used.

options.label: C
options.text: It is the method of choice in cardiac arrest patients.

options.label: D
options.text: Induction agent and muscle relaxant are given simultaneously.

questions.correct_answer: C. It is the method of choice in cardiac arrest patients.
questions.explanation: Ans. C. It is the method of choice in cardiac arrest patients

questions.text: 26-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to a skin condition. The patient has had dry, flaky skin since childhood, but it has worsened in recent years. Symptoms are typically worse in the winter but improve as the weather warms. The patient has a family history of asthma; both parents also have chronically dry skin. Examination is shown below. Which of the following is most likely contributing to this patient's condition?
Which of this best describes the components of HDI?

options.label: A
options.text: Economic growth rate, employment rate, and urbanization level.

options.label: B
options.text: Literacy rate and mean years of schooling, per capita income, and average life expectancy.

options.label: C
options.text: Natural resource availability, industrialization level, and net migration rate.

options.label: D
options.text: Health expenditure per capita, rate of technological advancement, and population growth rate.

questions.correct_answer: B. Literacy rate and mean years of schooling, per capita income, and average life expectancy.
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Literacy rate and mean years of schooling, per capita income, and average life expectancy

questions.text: Arrange the following anaesthetic agents on the basis of their potency? Nitrous oxide Halothane Isoflurane Methoxyflurane
questions.correct_answer: A. Methoxyflurane> Halothane> Isoflurane> Nitrous oxide
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Methoxyflurane> Halothane> Isoflurane> Nitrous oxide

questions.text: A 62-year-old man with diabetes, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia comes to the emergency department of medical center with chest pain, nausea, vomiting, and diaphoresis. An electrocardiogram demonstrates ST elevation in the anterior leads, and cardiac enzymes are markedly elevated. Investigators at the center are designing a randomized control trial to test the hypothesis that drug B will decrease the mortality associated with acute ST-elevation myocardial infarction compared to standard of care. To ensure that investigators will not miss a difference between drug B and standard of care (if a difference truly exists), which of the following would they want to maximize?

Identify the correct statements: Grade 2 disability per 10 lac population is the most important leprosy awareness indicator VVM shows cumulative exposure of the vaccine to the heat and assess vaccine potency As per the National Tuberculosis Elimination Program (NTEP), HIV-TB prevalence of district >15% is a high-priority district The external validity of a screening test is related to generalizability

A 6mm punch biopsy of normal appearing epidermis reveals stellar cells that contain intracytoplasmic granules as shown below. These cells demonstrate some myeloid surface markers and can interact closely with T lymphocytes. The cells described above are best referred to as which of the following?
On your evening walk in the park, you notice an unconscious man lying on the ground. What is the correct order of what should be done next?

options.label: A
options.text: Check carotid pulse, start CPR, and call for help; Defibrillate if no pulse

options.label: B
options.text: Call for help, check pulse, do CPR, Defibrillate when available

options.label: C
options.text: Verify scene safety, check airway, provide rescue breaths, chest compression

options.label: D
options.text: Check responsiveness, Verify scene safety, start chest compressions

questions.correct_answer: B. Call for help, check pulse, do CPR, Defibrillate when available
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Call for help, check pulse, do CPR, Defibrillate when available

questions.text: Which of the following statements is TRUE regarding sentinel surveillance?

options.label: A
options.text: Sentinel surveillance involves routine evaluation of subcentre reports.

options.label: B
options.text: Sentinel surveillance relies on passive case finding.

options.label: C
options.text: Sentinel surveillance is done in OPD of health centres.

options.label: D
options.text: Sentinel surveillance includes finding hidden or missing cases of diseases.

questions.correct_answer: D. Sentinel surveillance includes finding hidden or missing cases of diseases.
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Sentinel surveillance includes finding hidden or missing cases of diseases.

questions.text: Identify the true statements: Glycopyrrolate is used as an anti-sialagogue prior to surgery Duration of action of proparacaine is 15-20 minutes Thermodilution method using Fick Principle can be used to estimate the dead space volume Most common cause for delayed discharge from hospital post day care surgery is Postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV)
Sustainable development goals (SDGs) are under which health organization?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) UNDP

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) is the primary organization responsible for managing the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).

questions.text: A 36-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a 2-month history of a pruritic rash as shown below. The patient has been using skin emollients, but the lesions have not improved. Skin examination shows a papulovesicular skin rash in groups with erosion and excoriations. Which of the following is most likely to be seen in this patient?
A screening test is positive in 50% diseased population and 10% healthy population. Calculate the PPV:

A 29-year-old woman who is planning to start a family visits your clinic for preconception counseling. She is a healthcare worker and is concerned about her risk of exposure to various infections. She has received most standard vaccinations. She asks for your advice on vaccinations she should consider before becoming pregnant. Which of the following vaccines should you advise her to avoid receiving now, as she is planning for pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Varicella vaccine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Live vaccines , such as varicella and MMR, should be avoided for at least three months before conception. If already taken, women are advised to delay pregnancy to reduce any potential risks to fetal development.
  • ➤ Live vaccines

questions.text: A study is conducted to assess the relationship between smoking status and forced expiratory volume in one second (FEV1). Subjects are randomly selected and categorized based on smoking status. Group A consists of 200 nonsmokers, group B consists of 200 light smokers (1-7 cigarettes per day), group C consists of 200 moderate smokers (8-22 cigarettes per day), and group D consists of 200 heavy smokers (23+ cigarettes per day). FEV1 is quantitatively measured in all participants using properly calibrated office spirometers. Which of the following is the most appropriate statistical method to compare the mean FEV1 results among all 4 groups?
A 60-year-old male patient has grade III ASA. Which of the following post bronchodilator PFT findings requires further evaluation of the lung function of the patient?

A 25-year-old previously healthy man comes to the OPD due to penile lesions. The patient first noticed a nontender papule on his penis a month ago, and it has progressively increased in size and number. He reports no fever, dysuria, or penile discharge. There are no enlarged inguinal lymph nodes. Treatment is started with a topical agent that acts as a toll-like receptor agonist to increase antiviral cytokine production. Which of the following medications was most likely prescribed to this patient?

A 24-year-old G2 at 28 weeks is brought to the emergency after being found unconscious at home by her mother. She is disoriented on arrival and her BP is 180/110 mmHg and 4 + proteinuria. On arrival at the emergency, she has a tonic-clonic seizure which resolves with MgSO4 administration. Once the patient is stabilized, she undergoes caesarean delivery for fetal distress. Post-partum, the below MRI is done. What is the most likely finding on imaging?

A 64-year-old man comes to the OPD due to blisters on his trunk and groin. Itching has occurred for the past several weeks, and blisters developed a week ago. He has a history of hypertension and osteoarthritis. The patient received the zoster vaccine at age 60. Examination shows numerous 0.5- to 3-cm bullous skin lesions. The findings from a skin biopsy are shown in the image below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

400 women aged 20-35 coming for routine check-up are asked about their smoking status. 40% of the women are smokers. Over the next ten years, 25 smokers and 24 non-smokers developed breast cancer. Which of the following best describes the study design?

Identify the correct statements: The commonly used frequency of tetanic stimulation in neuromuscular monitoring is 50 Hz. The maximum oxygen flow rate which can be kept with a conventional oxygen mask is 10 L/min. Lorazepam can be used as an intravenous induction agent drug of choice for preoperative antibiotic prophylaxis in a patient undergoing cardiac surgery is Cefazolin

A 2-year-old boy is brought to the OPD by his mother due to a rash that started 3 days ago. A similar red, itchy rash on the cheeks, trunk, and arms has occurred intermittently since infancy. The mother had thought that the rashes were related to the consumption of certain foods, but elimination of cow's milk and fruits did not improve the rash. The patient has had a few upper respiratory infections but no major illnesses. Vaccinations are up to date, and he takes no medications. The diaper area is clear, and no mucosal lesions are present. This patient's current condition increases his risk of developing which of the following additional disorders?
Identify the maneuver being performed in the given image?

A 27-year-old woman comes to the emergency department with a 1-day history of skin rash. Two weeks ago, she had an episode of recurrent genital lesions, which began with small papules and subsequently became vesicular with ulceration, crusting, and eventual healing. On physical examination, she appears comfortable. Temperature is 37°C (98.6°F). Skin findings are shown in the image below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient is scheduled for surgery, and the anesthesia team needs to ensure the proper connection of the oxygen supply. Which of the following PIN (Pin-Index) configurations corresponds to the oxygen supply in medical gas cylinders?

There is a nuclear family consisting of a married couple and their two children. There is a spacing of 4 years between the births of children. Which phase of the Family Cycle is characterized by the first child moving out of the home of his/her parents?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Contraction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Contraction phase in the Family Life Cycle begins when the first child leaves the parental home.

questions.text: 61-year-old woman comes to the physician with a skin bumps on her trunk, as shown in the image below. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?
Identify the laryngeal mask airway from the picture below?
A patient with a history of severe asthma is scheduled for an appendectomy. Which of the following induction agents will cause the least respiratory depression?

An investigator is conducting a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled intention-to-treat clinical trial of a new drug for the treatment of peripheral neuropathy in adults with multiple myeloma (MM). One hundred fifty patients with MM are enrolled in the trial and randomized to receive either the new drug (n = 75) or placebo (n = 75). Trial protocol requires that patients in both groups take 1 pill per day and keep a pain diary. After 3 months of treatment, each patient is interviewed, and the pain diaries are reviewed; 9 patients taking the new drug and 3 patients taking placebo did not take the pills as instructed. Which of the following best describes how the data pertaining to all patients who did not adhere to protocol should be treated?

options.label: A
options.text: Conduct separate analyses of the 12 nonadherent patients and the 138 adherent patients

options.label: C
options.text: Exclude the 3 nonadherent patients in the group taking placebo from analysis

options.label: D
options.text: Keep all 12 nonadherent patients in their respective groups for analysis

questions.correct_answer: D. Keep all 12 nonadherent patients in their respective groups for analysis
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Keep all 12 nonadherent patients in their respective groups for analysis

questions.text: A 24-year-old young truck driver has developed a fissure in ano. What would be the ideal anesthesia for this case?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Saddle anesthesia

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Saddle anesthesia is the preferred choice for procedures involving the perineum, like fissure in ano, as it provides targeted anesthetic coverage to the relevant area without affecting the entire lower body.

questions.text: A 6-month-old boy is brought to the emergency department due to poor feeding, irritability, and rash. He was well-appearing until 2 days ago, when he developed little interest in drinking and a progressive rash. Physical examination reveals diffuse erythema and desquamation that is most prominent at the neck, axillae, inguinal folds, and perioral region. The perioral area also has crusting and the lips are dry and cracked, but the mucosal membranes are normal. The epidermis easily comes off with gentle pressure at the erythematous areas. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?

options.label: A
options.text: Autoantibody binding to epithelial cell surface

questions.text: A study was done to assess the risk factors for breast cancer in 100 females from urban cities. A statistical group and analysis are shown below. The values indicate the odds ratio and the 95% confidence interval. How many risk factors may be ascertained from the statistical analysis of the research?

Identify the correct statements Under Ayushman Bharat Scheme, a family can get upto 10lakh per year as insurance. Recent transmission of malaria can be calculated from API In villages, first contact of people to medical health care is PHC Low air velocity is measured by Kata thermometer
Identify the correct ASA-PS grade:

Identify the incorrect statement:

options.label: B
options.text: Additional energy requirement in pregnancyin 2 nd trimester: +350 kcal/day

options.label: C
options.text: Iodine requirement in lactation: 150 mcg per day

options.label: D
options.text: Vitamin D in pregnancy: 600 IU per day

questions.correct_answer: C. Iodine requirement in lactation: 150 mcg per day
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Iodine requirement in lactation: 150 mcg per day

questions.text: A 10 year old child has been diagnosed with diphtheria and is being treated in the ward. His 2.5-year-old brother, who lives in the same house has received all due vaccinations according to NIS. What is the next best step for the management of the younger sibling?

A 69-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a new growth on the outer canthus for 3 months. Examination shows no axillary or cervical lymphadenopathy. This patient's lesion most likely originated from which of the following?

An intern in the endocrinology department is asked to complete a chart review of cholesterol levels of all patients hospitalized with diabetes mellitus-related cardiovascular complications in the past 6 months. The intern's preliminary data analysis reveals that there were 400 such patients, and that serum cholesterol levels were normally distributed among the patients with a mean of 220 mg/dL and a standard deviation of 10 mg/dL. Based on these results, how many patients in this study would be expected to have serum cholesterol ≥240 mg/dL?

Identify the correct statements: FORD foundation is aiding in building toilets in India Normalcy of data can be measured by histogram, box-whisker plot and Shapiro-Wilk test CONSORT standards are for RCT Meta-analyses>RCT>Systematic review>Cohort>Case-control>expert opinion is the correct hierarchy for evidence

A 65-year-old man comes to the OPD due to skin lesions on his back. He first noted the spots 5 years ago and says they are becoming more numerous. The lesions are occasionally pruritic but are otherwise asymptomatic. Medical history is notable for hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?

A 48-year-old male with a history of severe obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) and a body mass index (BMI) of 45 presents for an emergent exploratory laparoscopy for an incarcerated inguinal hernia. He undergoes an uncomplicated induction and placement of an oral endotracheal tube via video laryngoscopy. The ideal volatile anesthetic for maintenance would be?

options.label: C
options.text: A volatile anesthetic with analgesic properties should be used to limit the amount of opioids required for the patient .

questions.correct_answer: B. The least soluble volatile anesthetic
questions.explanation: Ans. B. The least soluble volatile anesthetic

questions.text: What is the use of Stepwise approach of WHO in the context of public health interventions?

options.label: A
options.text: Strategies, Tactics, and Evaluation Plan for RTA accidents

options.label: C
options.text: Surveillance, Training, and Emergency Preparedness for Disasters

options.label: D
options.text: Stepwise, Tool-based, and Evidence-informed policy for Measles

questions.explanation:
Ans. B) NCD risk factor surveillance

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The WHO Stepwise approach is a tool for surveillance of non-communicable disease (NCD) risk factors , using standardized methods to collect behavioral, physical, and biochemical data.
  • ➤ WHO Stepwise approach
  • ➤ surveillance of non-communicable disease (NCD) risk factors

questions.text: A group of researchers found a correlation coefficient of 0.90 (p-value = 0.01) between the systolic BP and serum cholesterol levels of patients attending their clinics. Which of the following statements is an incorrect interpretation of this study?

options.label: A
options.text: The magnitude of systolic BP and serum cholesterol levels are closely related.

options.label: B
options.text: A patient with a high systolic BP is likely to have high serum cholesterol.

options.label: C
options.text: A patient with a low systolic BP is likely to have low serum cholesterol.

options.label: D
options.text: 80% of the variation in BP can be explained by serum cholesterol and vice versa.

questions.correct_answer: A. The magnitude of systolic BP and serum cholesterol levels are closely related.
questions.explanation: Ans. A. The magnitude of systolic BP and serum cholesterol levels are closely related.

questions.text: The best type of anesthesia for pre-eclampsia is:

A 34-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a persistent skin rash. He has a 6-month history of a scaly rash involving the upper and lower extremities that is associated with mild pruritus. Medical history is notable for childhood asthma and orolabial herpes simplex virus infection. On examination, the patient has skin lesions as shown in the image below. This patient's disorder is most likely associated with which of the following extradermal complications?
Identify the incorrect match:

options.label: B
options.text: SPEAK: To assess literacy in geriatric population

questions.text: Chronic liver disease is classified using the Child-Pugh score as follows: Class A: 5-6, Class B: 7-9, Class C: 10-15. What type of data is this scoring system?

A 28-year-old woman comes to the OPD to establish care. She usually eats fast food for lunch, and cooks in the evenings. She goes to the gym about once every 2 weeks. The patient's temperature is 36.7 C (98F), blood pressure is 118/64 mm Hg, pulse is 60/min, and respirations are 14/min. Her BMI is 24.6 kg/m2. Physical examination is unremarkable. Laboratory results are within the normal range. Counselling this patient regarding diet and exercise habits would be an example of which of the following?

A young man sustained multiple fractures following an RTA. He is being taken up for damage control surgery. His pulse is 120/min, BP 80/50mmHg, and also has cold extremities. What is the intravenous agent of choice for induction in him?

A 79-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to bleeding from an ulcerative lesion on her right nipple that she first noticed several months ago. The lesion is itchy and is slowly increasing in size. Examination shows a crusty, thickened, erythematous, and ulcerated nodule with evidence of hyperpigmentation. Changes extend to the surrounding areola. Excisional biopsy reveals relatively well-circumscribed aggregates of large, polygonal, pleomorphic cells with abundant mitotic activity and surrounding necrosis. S-100 and HMB-45 stains are diffusely positive. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which agency provides assistance to India in the procurement of supplies like x ray units, microscopes, and drugs for tuberculosis?
All of the following are transmitted by the following vector except:
Which of the following is set up for health planning at the village level?

options.label: B
options.text: Village Health Planning and Management Committee

options.label: D
options.text: Village Health Sanitation and Nutrition Committee

questions.correct_answer: D. Village Health Sanitation and Nutrition Committee
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Village Health Sanitation and Nutrition Committee

questions.text: 31-year-old woman comes to the physician with a skin rash in her axilla, as shown in the image below. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?
A patient of blunt chest trauma has been started on mechanical ventilation. Which of the following is not correct about the initial setting?
questions.correct_answer: D. Tidal volume -12ml/kg of actual BW
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Tidal volume -12ml/kg of actual BW

questions.text: A 50-year-old historian is researching the impact of medical advancements on society. He notes a significant shift in the leading causes of mortality from infectious to chronic diseases over the past century. This observation is crucial for understanding how public health strategies have evolved. What term best describes this shift in disease prevalence?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Epidemiological transition

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The term epidemiological transition best describes the shift in the leading causes of mortality from infectious to chronic diseases, a trend observed in more developed countries as public health strategies improve over time.
  • ➤ epidemiological transition

questions.text: A group of researchers want to identify factors related to hospital-acquired bacteremia caused by methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA). A total of 45 patients were enrolled in the study after MRSA was isolated from a blood sample taken from them on the third or subsequent day after admission. In addition, 90 patients admitted to the hospital over the same period with a length of stay >2 days who did not have bacteremia were randomly selected. The frequency of factors such as insertion of a central line or urinary catheter and surgical site infection were then compared between the 2 groups. Which of the following is the most appropriate null hypothesis for this study?

options.label: B
options.text: Hazard ratio is not equal to 1

options.label: D
options.text: Odds ratio is not equal to 1

questions.correct_answer: C. Odds ratio is equal to 1

questions.text: A 72-year-old man is evaluated due to a scaly lesion behind his right ear. A diagnosis of squamous cell carcinoma is confirmed on biopsy, and the patient undergoes excision of the lesion with clear margins. The wound is left to heal by secondary intention. Three weeks later, the patient returns to the office with a 2.5-cm raised, soft, granular lesion at the excision site. Biopsy of a representative lesion is shown in the image below. Which of the following is most likely responsible for this patient's postoperative changes?

options.label: B
options.text: Excess production of type I collagen

questions.text: In an intubated patient, after what duration of endotracheal intubation will you need to perform a tracheostomy?

An 8-year-old girl is brought to the OPD for evaluation of a skin rash on her upper back. The rash is not painful but is mildly pruritic. She has no prior medical conditions, takes no medications, and is up to date with vaccinations. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's current condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Deep tissue invasion by normal skin flora

options.label: B
options.text: Epidermal damage from excessive sun exposure

questions.correct_answer: D. Microbial infection of keratinized structures

questions.text: A 13-year-old girl was presented with fever and retro-orbital pain for 2 days. The tourniquet test and NS1 antigen test were positive. Which of the following features is considered a criterion for the severe form of this disease?
Which of the following is true about the steps of acute flaccid paralysis (AFP) surveillance?

options.label: A
options.text: Fecal samples should arrive at the lab within 48 hours of collection

options.label: B
options.text: All children with AFP should be tested within 72 hours of onset

options.label: C
options.text: Detect atleast 1 case of AFP/100000 children under 15 years

options.label: D
options.text: Fecal specimens should be transported at 2°C

questions.correct_answer: C. Detect atleast 1 case of AFP/100000 children under 15 years
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Detect atleast 1 case of AFP/100000 children under 15 years

questions.text: Identify the incorrect statements Target for Reduction of MMR by the year 2030 is <50 / lakh LB Role of Social factors in Disease causation is studied under Social Pathology Death should be registered within 21days Vacutainers should be discarded in yellow bag

A 28-year-old man comes to the OPD to discuss hair loss. He has hair loss primarily around the temples, which began insidiously 3 years ago. Physical examination shows moderate thinning of hair at the anterior scalp, temporal region, and vertex. An oral medication is prescribed to treat the hair loss. After the initiation of therapy, which of the following changes would most likely occur in this patient in Testosterone, Dihydrotestosterone and Estradiol respectively?
Which of the following is an inactivated vaccine?
There is an outbreak of acute encephalitis in the community and a vaccination drive is launched. Which of the following is true about the vaccine given in this condition?

Identify the correct statements: Barometer of Social Welfare is TB MONICA project focusses on Systematically monitoring trends and determinants in cardiovascular disease A death is attributed to a road traffic accident if it occurs within 60 days post-incident. Jai Vigyan Mission project is meant for control of RHD.

A novel serum biomarker is being evaluated for early detection of pancreatic cancer. The concentration of this substance has been found to be elevated in patients with pancreatic adenocarcinoma. Test results in 200 volunteers ("healthy") and 190 patients with biopsy-proven pancreatic cancer ("diseased") are given in the figure below. The investigators determined the sensitivity and specificity of this indicator for pancreatic cancer using a cutoff of 200 IU/dL (indicated by the solid vertical. If they had instead used a lower cutoff as indicated by the dashed vertical line, which of the following would most likely be seen?

A 42-year-old man who was under home isolation after testing positive for COVID-19 develops breathing difficulty and is brought to the ER. The patient is alert and responsive but is breathing rapidly. Sp02 is measured to be 86%. He is administered oxygen via a face mask with a reservoir bag with a flow rate of 10 L/min. After a trial of one hour, his Sp02 is 88%. What is the next step in management?
questions.correct_answer: B. High-flow nasal cannula oxygen therapy
questions.explanation: Ans. B. High-flow nasal cannula oxygen therapy

questions.text: A 44-year-old man comes to the OPD with a 4-day history of severe left-sided chest discomfort. The pain is constant and has a burning quality. Over the last day, the patient has developed a rash in the area of discomfort. He has not had similar symptoms before. Which of the following pathologic findings is most likely to be found in the affected area?

options.label: C
options.text: Koilocytosis of the superficial epidermal layers

questions.correct_answer: D. Multinucleated cells with intranuclear inclusions

questions.text: What is the dose and route of the birth dose of BCG vaccine?
Which of the following methods provides the most complete evaluation of protein quality?

Research is being conducted to assess the nutritional status of the children in a particular district. For this purpose, 2 children are randomly selected from every school in the district. What is this type of sampling known as?
All of the following are used as an anti-larval measure in mosquito control programs except:

A 64-year-old man comes to the emergency department due to worsening left lower extremity pain, swelling, and redness over the past 3 days. The patient has had no trauma but reports feeling feverish. Medical history is significant for hypertension and obesity. Physical examination shows diffuse erythema extending up to the left midcalf with indistinct border. There is increased warmth, tenderness, and edema of the left leg. No areas of fluctuation or purulent exudate are present, but the interdigital skin of the feet is macerated and fissured. Laboratory testing shows neutrophilic leukocytosis, and Doppler ultrasonography is negative for deep venous thrombosis. Infection with which of the following organisms is most likely responsible for this patient's current symptoms?
